item.title: Flights grounded as Russia’s largest airline Aeroflot hit by cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Russian prosecutor said it opened a criminal investigation into the cyberattack targeting Aeroflot, the largest airline in Russia.

item.title: ‘Wizard of Oz’ blown up by AI for giant Sphere screen
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The massive Las Vegas venue known as Sphere will be screening its first classic movie, “The Wizard of Oz,” starting on August 28. And as detailed in a segment on CBS Sunday Morning, this isn’t just a matter of taking the existing movie and projecting it on Sphere’s 160,000 square foot, wraparound LED screen.

item.title: Itch.io is the latest marketplace to crack down on adult games
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Indie video game marketplace Itch.io announced this week that it has "deindexed" adult and not-safe-for-work games, removing them from its browse and search pages.

item.title: DOGE has built an AI tool to slash federal regulations
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The Department of Government Efficiency has presented plans to use a new AI tool to eliminate half of the federal government’s regulatory mandates by the first anniversary of President Donald Trump’s return to office, according to The Washington Post.

item.title: U.K. starts enforcing online age check rules
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A U.K. law requiring that pornography websites verify the age of their users took effect Friday.

item.title: Astronomer winks at viral notoriety with ‘temporary spokesperson’ Gwyneth Paltrow
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: After spending the past week-plus in the headlines due to a seemingly inescapable social media scandal, data operations startup Astronomer is trying to shift the narrative with a tongue-in-cheek video starring actress and entrepreneur Gwyneth Paltrow.

item.title: Dating safety app Tea breached, exposing 72,000 user images
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Tea, an app that allows women to post anonymous comments about men they’ve supposedly dated, announced Friday that it has suffered a data breach, with hackers gaining access to 72,000 images.

item.title: Tesla vet says that ‘reviewing real products’ — not mockups — is the key to staying innovative
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: “No slides was our first rule,” McNeil told the audience earlier this month at TC All Stage in Boston. “You have to be reviewing real product.”

item.title: Allianz Life says ‘majority’ of customers’ personal data stolen in cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Exclusive: Allianz Life said the "majority" of its customers and employees had data stolen in the July cyberattack. The company said it has notified the FBI.

item.title: Tesla wants to bring robotaxis to San Francisco. Here’s what’s standing in the way.
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane, Kirsten Korosec
item.description: There will be an employee in the driver's seat -- a big change from how things have been working in Austin.

item.title: India bans streaming apps you’ve never heard of — but millions watch
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India has ordered the blocking of 25 streaming services — many with millions of viewers and even paying subscribers — for allegedly promoting "obscene" content.

item.title: Index Ventures’ Jahanvi Sardana shares the truth about TAM and what founders should focus on instead
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Index Ventures partner Jahanvi Sardana has a reminder for all those founders worried about finding TAM for their product or service: many startups have emerged from markets that, at the time, were essentially nonexistent.

item.title: Intel is spinning off its Network and Edge group
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Intel will remain an anchor investor in the stand-alone company, which produced $5.8 billion in revenue in 2024.

item.title: Meta names Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of AI superintelligence unit
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Shengjia Zhao, a former OpenAI researcher, will round out the leadership team at Meta's new AI lab.

item.title: AI referrals to top websites were up 357% year-over-year in June, reaching 1.13B
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: AI platforms in June 2025 generated over 1.13 billion referrals to the top 1,000 websites globally, up 357% year-over-year.

item.title: Sam Altman warns there’s no legal confidentiality when using ChatGPT as a therapist
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: In response to a question about how AI works with today's legal system, Altman said one of the problems of not yet having a legal or policy framework for AI is that there's no legal confidentiality for users' conversations.

item.title: A timeline of the US semiconductor market in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: From leadership changes at legacy semiconductor companies to wishy washy policy around chip exports, a lot has happened already.

item.title: Google took a month to shut down Catwatchful, a phone spyware operation hosted on its servers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Google has suspended the Firebase account of Catwatchful following a TechCrunch investigation. The spyware operation was caught using Google's own servers to host and run its surveillance app, which was stealthily monitoring thousands of people's phones.

item.title: Lyft to add autonomous shuttles in 2026 as Uber inks more self-driving deals
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: It's one of just a few similar partnerships Lyft has struck, while rival Uber has an increasingly long list of robotaxi deals.

item.title: Apple broadens App Store’s age-rating system
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple has expanded its age-rating system to include 13+, 16+, and 18+ ratings, in addition to the existing ratings for younger users.
